benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: DELETE /1.0/kb/invoiceItems/{invoiceItemId}/tags - Remove tags from invoice item

covered: Valid deletion scenarios: TC01 (remove all) and TC02 (remove subset) confirm deletion behavior on existing invoice items; TC04 covers deletion when the item has no tags; TC03 covers optional headers used during deletion.
Query parameter handling: TC02, TC05, TC06, TC07, TC16 cover presence/absence, empty, extra, and partially specified tagDef inputs.

Error handling and validation: TC08 (not found), TC09 (invalid ID format), TC10 (missing X-Killbill-CreatedBy), TC11 (invalid token), TC12 (service unavailable), TC13 (malformed tagDef values), TC14 (too many tagDef values), TC15 (malicious header payloads), TC16 (partial tagDef), TC18 (special characters in headers), and TC20 (accessibility).
gaps: Rate limiting: no tests for throttling or burst DELETE requests.
Caching behavior: no tests for caching headers (ETag/Cache-Control) on DELETE responses.
Soft delete semantics: no explicit test verifying soft vs hard deletion semantics (if applicable).
recommendations: Add a test for 403 Forbidden to cover authorization/permissions, and consider 401 vs 403 distinction as needed.
Introduce rate limiting/throttling tests to validate behavior under high request volumes.
Add tests to verify caching headers on DELETE responses (ETag, Cache-Control) and caching behavior.
Clarify and test soft-delete semantics if relevant (audit trails, deletion flags).
Consider additional accessibility tests focusing on error message clarity across scenarios.
